techmeme.title: Some in Silicon Valley hope Kamala Harris would provide a chance for a reset, after years of bipartisan criticism in Washington DC toward big tech companies (Politico)
CrowdStrike says the problematic July 19 software update that affected 8.5M Windows devices was deployed into production due to "a bug in the Content Validator" (Simon Sharwood/The Register)
Foxconn to invest $138 mln for new business headquarters in China (Reuters)
Sources: enterprise financial software maker OneStream raised $490M after pricing its IPO at $20 a share, above its $17-$19 marketed range, at a $4.6B valuation (Echo Wang/Reuters)
Elon Musk says Starlink service is now active in a hospital in Gaza, reflecting Israel's reluctance for Gaza residents to have internet access more broadly (Eva Dou/Washington Post)
